problem_summary_simple: Count arrangements of n sticks so exactly k are visible from the left.
problem_summary_technical: DP state dp[i][j] represents ways to arrange i sticks with j visible. Transitions consider placing the i-th stick.
key_insights: The problem can be solved using dynamic programming.
Consider placing the i-th stick: it can be the tallest (visible) or not (hidden).
If visible, it must be placed at the end of an arrangement of i-1 sticks with j-1 visible. If hidden, it can be placed anywhere among the i-1 sticks, not being the tallest.
